net.openhft.lang.io

Interface ByteStringParser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BytesCommon
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Bytes, IByteBufferBytes, NativeBytesI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, BoundsCheckingDirectBytes, BoundsCheckingNativeBytes, ByteBufferBytes, DirectByteBufferBytes, DirectBytes, MultiStoreBytes, NativeBytes, VanillaMappedBytes, WrappedBytes

    public interface ByteStringParser
extends BytesCommon
    Author:
    peter.lawrey

        alignPositionAddr, byteOrder, capacity, checkEndOfBuffer, clear, finish, flip, inputStream, isFinished, limit, limit, load, objectSerializer, outputStream, position, position, remaining, slice, slice, sliceAsByteBuffer, toDebugString, toDebugString, toString

    • Method Detail

      • selfTerminating

        void selfTerminating(boolean selfTerminate)
        If set to true, the end of the Bytes will be the end of any consuming String, double or long. If false, incomplete reads will throw a BufferUnderflowException
        Parameters:
        selfTerminate - if true, the end of the Buffer is silent.

      • selfTerminating

        boolean selfTerminating()
        Returns:
        if this Bytes self terminates.

      • readUnsignedByteOrThrow

        int readUnsignedByteOrThrow()
                            throws BufferUnderflowException
        Returns:
        the next unsigned byte or -1 if selfTerminating and the end is reached.
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException - if the end is reached and selfTerminating is false.

      • parseBoolean

        Boolean parseBoolean(@NotNull
                   StopCharTester tester)
                     throws BufferUnderflowException
        Return true or false, or null if it could not be detected as true or false. Case is not important

        false: f, false, n, no, 0

        true: t, true, y, yes, 1

        Parameters:
        tester - to detect the end of the text.
        Returns:
        true, false, or null if neither.
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException

      • parseUTF

        void parseUTF(@NotNull
            StringBuilder builder,
            @NotNull
            StopCharTester tester)
              throws BufferUnderflowException
        Populate a StringBuilder with the UTF encoded text until the end.
        Parameters:
        builder - to zeroOut and append to.
        tester - to detect when to stop.
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException

        Make sure we just read a stop character
        Parameters:

        Returns:
